body.p:
Camp 11" Ky Cav Near Acworth Ga
June 9th 1864
To his Excellency
Thos E Bramlet Gov of Ky
Dear Sir

We the undersigned officers of the 11" Ky Cavalry having received information of the acceptance of the resignation of A J Alexander as Lieut Col of this regt. do recommend & request, the vacancy so occassioned be filled by the appointment of Milton Graham 1st Maj of the regt. If however Maj Grahams health will not allow him to accept the appointed or if for chance, something should prevent you from issuing to him the commission. Then we request that you appoint some one of age & experience in the field, someone who has served with & undergone ^all^ the hardships of the regt since its organization. For we honestly believe the appointment of any one also will greatly cripple the efficency of the regt.

Wm P Pierce Lt & Adjt
F. Slater Capt Co E. 11th Ky Cav
names on other side
W H Bell Capt co D 11th Ky Cav
Joseph Lawson Capt Com Co G 11th Reg Ky Cav
Dumm R Stage 2d Lt Co E 11" Ky Cav
John J Curtis Lt Co F 11th Ky Cav
J. M. William Lt Co.G. 11th Ky Cav and A. R. Q. M
Jas. F. Peyton, Surgeon, 11th Regt, Ky, Cav. Vols
D. E. W. Smith 1st Lieut Co H 11th Ky Vol Cavl
J M Cotton 2 Lieut co a 11 Ky cav comdg C
W.. H Norton H Co "C" 11 Ky. Cav comdg Co
James W. Robinson 1st Lt Co.. D.. 11th Ky Cav
Wm M Simpson Lt & Reg'l Quartermaster
P F Hansbrough 1st Lieut Comdg Co. B. 11th Ky Cav

Hd Quarters 3rd Brig Cavl Command
June 10th 1864

After having served in the army with Maj Graham over one year and having him under my immediate command six months during the E Tenn campaign I take pleasure in recommending him as a true faithful & brave soldier

S Adams Lt Col
1st Ky Cavl

Camp 11th Ky Cavalry
Near acworth, Ga
June 9th. 1864
Pierce W P. Lt & Adjt } & others
To the Governor petitioning that the vacancy of Lt Col of the 11th Cavl be filled by the appointment of 1st Maj Milton Graham In case he does not accept you appoint some one of age and Experience.
